item.title: Docs: About blueprints
item.description:
Introduction

Blueprints are a powerful feature for extending XploR with custom features and behaviors. The Blueprint Catalog is a ip-as-a-service (IaaS) platform that provides an exhaustive list of the existing blueprints.

Prerequisite: You can reach the Blueprint Catalog from the XploR Studio Dashboard the Blueprints menu entry.

How it works

Build Your Own Blueprints

XploR users can create their own blueprints and share them with the community using the Blueprint Catalog.

XploR will load blueprints dynamically. They need not be compiled, and no complex toolchain is necessary to build them. The experience of implementing a XploR blueprint is comparable to writing a web browser extension.

To learn more about XploR blueprint creation, please refer to the developer documentation.

item.title: Docs: Guidelines
item.description:
After the successful installation in Installation Guide, the baseline IDE only contains Baremetal XploR Toolchain for RISC-V (if this option is selected when installing).

To use other projects like Embedded Linux or LLVM projects, it is necessary to download and install some dependencies packaged as blueprints.

Select the icon in the toolbar, it will show a list of available blueprints:

Note:

  • There are two types of Blueprint servers: Stable server for usage and Development server for development.
  • Current Version and Available Version columns will indicate your computer’s current version and the server’s available version.
  • Status column will inform whether this blueprint is installed.

To install the desired blueprint, check the box in the No. column and select Install. One or more blueprints can be installed at the same time.

If a blueprint has various versions, you can cherry-pick the exact one you desire by simply double-clicking on the blueprint.
